pullRequest.body:
In this pull request, we have proved the following results:

```
variable {S : Type*} [CommRing S]

@[simp, norm_cast]
lemma Polynomial.coe_neg (p : S[X]) : (- p : S[X]).toPowerSeries = - (p : PowerSeries S) :=
  coeToPowerSeries.ringHom.map_neg p

@[simp, norm_cast]
lemma Polynomial.coe_sub (p q : S[X]) :
    (p - q : S[X]).toPowerSeries = (p : PowerSeries S) - (q : PowerSeries S) :=
  coeToPowerSeries.ringHom.map_sub p q

theorem Polynomial.coe_one_sub :
    (1 - X : S[X]).toPowerSeries = 1 - (PowerSeries.X : PowerSeries S) := by
  simp
```

### PR summary [b8be67adfb](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19339/commits/b8be67adfb7f198ea74f449363d9285b9e633663)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ coe_neg`
`+ coe_sub`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
A minor style point: these blank lines are mostly a mathport-ism
This one looks a bit too specialized. Do we have the same for other coercions?
I agree, I think we should remove this one.
This section is currently in the middle of a section about `CommSemiring`; can you wrap the existing material in a `section` too, and make sure they don't overlap?

> Sorry I'm not sure about what you mean by "wrapping the existing material in a `section`". Shall I move the section `CommRing` elsewhere so that it is not a subsection of any section?

Sorry I'm not sure about what you mean by "wrapping the existing material in a section". Shall I move the section `CommRing` elsewhere so that it is not a subsection of any section?

a style nit:
```suggestion
section CommRing
variable {R : Type*} [CommRing R]
```
(by which I mean, delete the blank line below)
Can you write these in the same style as `coe_add` above? That is, without using `.toPowerSeries`.

pullRequest.title: Feat(RingTheory/PowerSeries/Basic): proved that `(1 - X : S[X]).toPowerSeries = 1 - (PowerSeries.X : PowerSeries S)`.
